channel.title: BBC News - Home

item.title: Coronavirus: WHO halts trials of hydroxychloroquine over safety fears
item.description: Testing of hydroxychloroquine as a possible coronavirus treatment is suspended by the health agency.

item.title: UK minister quits over Cummings' lockdown actions
item.description: Douglas Ross resigns as Tory minister after the PM's senior aide defends travelling during lockdown.

item.title: White woman called police on black man in dog row
item.description: The woman has now been suspended from her job at an investment firm in New York City.

item.title: Coronavirus: A day of lockdown for young people in the UK
item.description: As one of the demographics hit hardest by the pandemic, young people document 24 hours in lockdown.

item.title: Clickbait and podcasts: France frowns on English words
item.description: The French language enrichment commission announces a new list of alternatives to English terms.

item.title: Republican National Convention: Trump threatens to move event from North Carolina
item.description: The president wants North Carolina to ensure there are no restrictions on crowds due to the pandemic.

item.title: Hong Kong security law: Carrie Lam dismisses concerns over rights
item.description: Carrie Lam says a security law planned by China is a "responsible" move which won't infringe on rights.

item.title: Zara Abid: Model presumed dead in Pakistan plane crash abused online
item.description: Zara Abid, 28, was being mourned by friends and family, but then trolls began abusing her legacy online.

item.title: Trans Mountain pipeline: Protest ban is 'great time' to build, says minister
item.description: Alberta's energy minister cites a ban on protests when asked about a controversial project in Canada.

item.title: Australia bushfires: Hundreds of deaths linked to smoke, inquiry hears
item.description: More than 4,000 people were admitted to hospital due to the smoke, a government inquiry has heard.

item.title: Stanley Ho: Hong Kong's 'king of gambling' dies aged 98
item.description: Ho was credited with steering Macau to overtake Las Vegas as the gambling capital of the world.

item.title: Boy, 12, followed down mountain by brown bear
item.description: Alessandro was hiking with his family in northern Italy when they realised he was being followed.

item.title: Coronavirus: French alarm at Covid-linked Med pollution
item.description: Environmentalists in the south of France find masks and gloves littering the seabed.

item.title: In pictures: Indigenous nurse on frontline in virus fight
item.description: Vanderlecia Ortega dos Santos is the sole nurse caring for a community of 700 in Manaus, Brazil.

item.title: Thailand: Elephants on 'great migration' to survive coronavirus starvation
item.description: With the collapse of the tourism industry because of the coronavirus, Thailand's captive elephants are now at risk of starvation.

item.title: Coronavirus: Artist adds Queen in face mask to collection
item.description: Emelie Hryhoruk said We Will Meet Again "shows everyone is vulnerable no matter who they are".

item.title: Coronavirus: 'I see a lot of people, I don't see any masks'
item.description: Scores of people visited beach destinations over the Memorial Day weekend, not all abiding by the guidelines.

item.title: Coronavirus pandemic: Tracking the global outbreak
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the respiratory virus has spread around the world and how it is being dealt with.

item.title: Balbir Singh: India mourns loss of hockey legend and independence hero
item.description: Balbir Singh, who has died aged 95, helped seal hockey gold for newly independent India in 1948.

item.title: Indonesia: Alone in a sinking village
item.description: Once home to more than 200 families, the village of Bedono in Central Java is now under water.

item.title: The South Korean Samsung protester living in the sky
item.description: Kim Yong-hee has spent nearly a year on a 20m traffic tower to protest against Samsung's zero-union policy.

item.title: Coronavirus: Creative solutions to social distancing
item.description: As some lockdown restrictions ease, countries are finding inventive ways to keep people safe in public spaces.

item.title: The Metro Manila priests fighting coronavirus with the cross
item.description: Catholic priests in Metro Manila are risking their lives to serve their poverty-stricken community.

item.title: Italy's medical workers: 'We became heroes but they've already forgotten us'
item.description: With Italy past the peak of coronavirus, medical staff say the trauma is only just hitting them now.

item.title: Coronavirus: Call for clear face masks to be 'the norm'
item.description: Transparent masks allow deaf people to communicate - but supplies are short where they are most needed.

item.title: Coronavirus: The strangers reaching out to Kyrgyzstan's lonely teenagers
item.description: Worried by teens' mental health struggles during Kyrgyzstan's coronavirus lockdown, one group acted.

item.title: Space debris: Smart solutions sought to make orbital traffic safer
item.description: The UK Space Agency is seeking novel ideas to track all the pieces of debris now moving in orbit.

item.title: 'I left my campervan in Argentina'
item.description: Thousands of van-driving nomads were living the dream - until the coronavirus pandemic brought them to a sudden halt.

item.title: Dominic Cummings: Who is Boris Johnson's senior adviser?
item.description: The controversial former Vote Leave campaign director is the PM's most senior adviser.

item.title: Coronavirus outbreak: Caribbean tourism struggles as visitors stay home
item.description: Tourism is vital to the Caribbean but visitors are absent amid the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Coronavirus in Sudan exposes new leaders
item.description: Some medics have refused to work and elderly people have been dying, writes Zeinab Mohammed Salih.

item.title: I think Ryder Cup will be postponed - McIlroy
item.description: World number one Rory McIlroy believes this year's Ryder Cup will be postponed until 2021 because players are not keen on playing in it without fans.

item.title: Jadon Sancho: Could the England forward be the heir to Lionel Messi's crown?
item.description: Jadon Sancho has similarities in his game to Lionel Messi, but can he go on to emulate the Barcelona forward?

item.title: Players face '25% increased injury risk' when Premier League returns
item.description: Premier League players could be 25% more susceptible to injury when football resumes because of the intense schedule, research shows.

item.title: Haaland & Lewandowski prepare to meet in Bundesliga's Der Klassiker
item.description: Strikers Robert Lewandowski and Erling Braut Haaland to meet in crucial 'Der Klassiker' on Tuesday.

item.title: Sports events in UK 'shut down too late to save lives'
item.description: A top scientist criticises the staging of the Cheltenham Festival and Liverpool's Champions League tie.

item.title: McIlroy's caddie goes into US quarantine before PGA Tour return
item.description: Rory McIlroy's caddie Harry Diamond is set to spend two weeks in quarantine in Florida so that he can be on McIlroy's bag for the PGA Tour's return.
